question: Which two Indian cities are placed in the list of HexGn "Global Top 10 Cities for Start-up Funding" for 2020?
explanation: A leading research agency, HexGn conducted a study of the funding patterns in the start-up ecosystem in the year 2019. The total international funding for technology start-ups decreased by 22% to $293 billion when compared to the funding of $375 billion, last year. However, the start-up funding in India has grown by 18% to $14 billion in 2019. For the first time, two Indian cities namely Delhi NCR and Bengaluru were ranked in the \"Global Top 10 Cities for Start-up Funding\" list.
